reviews.text: A monumental tribute to how much the reverential cherished their scriptural treasures,  that manifested itself into the largest book in the world, that took years to complete. Do not waste your visit by limiting it to an idle stroll or merely taking pictures, but try to absorb the pervading divinity.

Really enjoyed my visit to this temple. Its a little different to most temples around. You can access it from a number of different sides. The temple I'd free to enter and shoes are free to be left. Don't listen to any touts that tell you otherwise. The temple was surprisingly quiet, this made is easy to walk around and take pictures.
The largest book in the world is not to be missed. I was surprised how much more popular this was than I imagined. A lot of people are drawn to its immensity.

Historic and architectural landmark maintaining Myanmar culture. 
This pagoda is surrounded by a huge numbers of ancient marble inscription. 
You can donate Lotus and apply Myanmar Thanakar to your face.
We always go there with my big family. It is very nice with the Khayay tree. There are a lot of place for many people.

Very old and ancient wooden monastery. Recommend to visit the place early in the morning or if not possible during lunch time to avoid loud and rude travel groups.
The place is worth to stay quiet to enjoy the old art. There is a entrance fee of 10000 Kyats.
Can see the wonderful Myanmar art. Amazing buildings.
A nice place of Mandalay
Peaceful with great arts.

Beautiful monastery from the outside because I didn't go inside! They want to charge you 10'000 kyats when the cost is 200 for the local people... The girl at the counter doesn't know any words of English and she's not able to tell you than the ticket is not only for this place but also to go to the palace and some others places!

Very old and ancient wooden monastery. Recommend to visit the place early in the morning or if not possible during lunch time to avoid loud and rude travel groups.
The place is worth to stay quiet to enjoy the old art. There is a entrance fee of 10000 Kyats.
Can see the wonderful Myanmar art. Amazing buildings.
A nice place of Mandalay
Peaceful with great arts.

Beautiful monastery from the outside because I didn't go inside! They want to charge you 10'000 kyats when the cost is 200 for the local people... The girl at the counter doesn't know any words of English and she's not able to tell you than the ticket is not only for this place but also to go to the palace and some others places!

Very reasonable 10 Euro for an audio tour of the palace. I would highly recommend to anyone! There are kids audio options and if you are really interested in something you can get even more information via audio. The staff are SUPER friendly and there is a cloakroom for your bag and coats.

Beautiful palace that just inspires awe at every turn. To be among such great pieces of work and history is truly humbling.

This place is very befitting of the title "Royal" and is a marvel with the intricacies of the paintings, sculptures, and works of art scattered throughout.

The admission is fairly priced and comes with a free audio tour that provides nuggets of information on the various rooms and history associated with them. Additionally, the tour gives you options of learning the extra facts relating to a sculpture and/or painting.

I really feel like you could come here 2 or 3 times and still learn or see something new here. Absolutely beautiful in hundreds of ways, witnessing this building and all its treasures firsthand is something spectacular. Pictures don't do it justice.

Anything to do with Amsterdam is already good enough for me. Add to that a chance to take in the Royal Palace, the cherry has been placed on my tourism cake. 

Taking a walking tour was well worth it. We learned so much from our guide, it truly made the experience memorable.

If you have the time, why not do it? The architecture that surrounds the area alone, is well worth it.

First of all, if you're into interesting buildings, you can never go wrong with palaces. This type of buildings are always the place of many interesting stories. This city hall turned palace during the reign of Napoleon is no different. Large halls full of exquisite art and the most expensive furniture give you a peek at how it is to be a dignitary in the Netherlands. The excellent audio tour (with a special version for kids) in a dozen languages that allows you to wander through the halls in your own tempo makes it a five star to visit. No rush, just interesting history.

It’s amazing that you’re able to walk in and explore the actual Royal Palace! There’s a wide range of different rooms - all with unique snippets of history attached. Joy for the whole family - would definitely recommend visiting it if you’re in Amsterdam.

Unlike many other sightseeing places, this one is very kid- and English-friendly. Kids get their own audio guide and a little necklace to fill out to keep them interested. For adults there are various language available - including English.
Sunnyside is an amazing park, I was there for the Coca Cola Classic Disc Golf Tournament. Awesome weekend.
Loved the park with the rolling hills and trees. Had a wonderful firepit and frisbee golf
Nice relaxing place to picnic or just chill and listen to nature.
Nice quiet place to camp without the noise. Secluded and safe
Nice playground equipment, lots of shade trees, not much traffic. Nice place to have a picnic and play.

reviews.author_name: Polwankopo ေပ်ာ္ေပ်ာ္ေနတက္ျကသူမ်ားရဲ႕ အဖြဲ႕
reviews.text: for you happy tine
Nice bar on the 7th floor, open to non residents. Prices very reasonable and service friendly and with decent English.
Good
It's a quiet place to chill.
La gentillesse du personnel et la qualité des cocktails compense le manque de goût de la déco de la salle de restau. Pas de terrasse extérieure.

Hi all, this is a fantastic restaurant, if you want to have really good, healthy and rich Indian dinner.

We came here and were starving. The variety of tastes and spices was overwhelming and we all have a fantastic evening including the most amazing food.

I can only recommend this place for anyone who wants to have a nice evening / eating time together with friends or family. The atmosphere is discretely exclusive and we immediately felt warmly welcomed by the staff.

Thank you very much for the nice experience and we will definitely come back, when we are around next time!

Cheers!

The taste of the food was quite good. But: it is way more expensive than you think- you get charged taxes and service and the dishes don't come with rice and you need to order plain rice extra for 2.000 k per portion. Also i got food poisoned and puked the whole night- I am 100% it came from the dish I ate here because I didn't really ate anything else this day.

The food was nice and the staff are friendly. I got the okra and mushroom curry (pictured), which was very nice. Main problem was the prices, which were pretty high. I don't think there was any main dish on the menu for less than 5000 kyat. There are also limited options for vegans as most of the curries contain cream. If you are vegetarian, vegan, or on a budget, I'd highly recommend Marie Min instead.

Mixed feelings... Uttam, the Manager ensures that you feel like a king... The staff Wonderful... Some dishes are nice, while others forgettable... Well, this is the only place we can take our guests to, especially when they are craving for Indian food.

If you need a break from Burmese food, this is a great place to eat something different! Service is good and food came in fast after we ordered. Easy to reach by scooter and very close to a great spa!

Amazing, so much food for such little price. Attentive & helpful staff, setting & location great. Don't order a lot because you get soup, side dishes & rice with your main meal & it's all so delicious 😋 Then they bring out dessert, tea leaf salad & sticky rice balls both fabulous. A must destination in Mandalay

Fantastic place. Do not order too much, cause u get plenty of extras you will never be able to eat!
Just order one meal each and u get 4-5 extras.
All the food is delicious, can be rather spicy and I enjoyed also complimentary tea with complimentary sweets as dessert.
A modern restaurant with traditional receipes. Prices r also reasonable. Dishes are tasty and nice. Wanna recommend if one wants to try Burmese cuisines and desserts!

Good but not the best place for vegetarians in the city. The place is very clean and odour free ( as you can find in a lot of Myanmar restaurants). The best part is a self explanatory menu. 

You have to order one main dish and it will come with unlimited rice and 5-6 side dishes. Only problem was that the choices were limited for vegetarians in main curry section.
You will have to do with Mingalabar, because unfortunately there isn't much else in Mandalay. It's good though. The staff is obviously super friendly like almost all Burmese people.
